487-d-04-27-87-PATH.Narrative: AT 8:18 ON APRIL 27, 1987, THE MOTORMAN AND CONDUCTOR, ON BOARD THE JOURNAL SQUARE TO 33RD ST. TRAINREPORTED FROM CRISTOPHER ST. STATION THAT THEY HAD JUST BEEN STRUCK IN THE REAR. THE CARS IN THE CONSIST INCLUDED 680-112-828-668-672-826-835. SUPERVISORY PERSONNEL RESPONDED TO THE SCENE AND ASCERTAINED THAT AN 'ADD' HAD BEEN EFFECTED BY THE STRIKING TRAIN. CARS IN THE CONSIST INCLUDED 758-156-644-722-633-683-665. PASSENGERS WERE CHECKED FOR ANY INJURIES THEN OFF-LOADED AND INSTRUCTED ON ALTERNATE MEANS OF COMMUNICATION. THE CONSISTS WERE THEN SEPARATED. AT 8:42 AM, THE MOTORMAN ON THE JOURNALSQUARE TO 33RD ST. TRAIN REPORTED THAT HIS TRAIN WAS FULLY CHARGED AND PROCEEDED TO 33RD ST STATION. AT 8:46 AM THE HOBOKEN TO 33RD ST TRAIN PROCEEDED WITHOUT FURTHER DELAY RUNNING EXPRESS TO 33RD ST. STATION.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

287-d-04-13-87-PATH.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 1:58PM ON MONDAY, APRIL 13, 1987 THE MOTORMAN OPERATING THE 1:46PM 33RD-HOBOKEN TRAIN NOTIFIED THE TRAINMASTER THAT HIS TRAIN HAD STRUCK THE BUMPING BLOCK ON #1 TRACK IN HOBOKEN. THEOPERATING CAR (739) WAS DERAILED AND THERE WAS DAMAGE TO THE BUMPING BLOCK AND THE PLATFORM AREA.THETRAINMASTER IMMEDIATELY HAD THE POWER REMOVED FROM #1 TRACK AND NOTIFIED THE POLICE DESK, CAR EQUIPMENT DIVISION AND THE TRACK AND STRUCTURES DIVISION. TRANSPORTATION DIVISION SUPERVISORY PERSONNEL WERE ALSO DISPATCHED TO THE SCENE. SHORTLY AFTER THE INITIAL REPORT OF THE ACCIDENT, THE HOBOKEN DISPATCHER REQUESTED AN AMBULANCE BE SENT TO HOBOKEN FOR 2 PASSENGERS WHO REPORTED POSSIBLE INJURIES. ONLY ONE PASSENGER WAS TRANSPORTED TO CHRIST HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS TREATED AND RELEASED. BOTH CREW MEMBERS WERE ALSO ESCORTED TO CHRIST HOSPITAL FOR NECESSARY MEDICAL TESTS AS OUTLINED IN THE FRA DRUG TESTING REGULATIONS, ANDTHE INDIVIDUALS WERE ADVISED TO REPORT TO PORT AUTHORITY MEDICAL DEPT ON TUESDAY, APRIL 14, 1987 FOR MEDICAL EVALUATIONS.NoneNoneNoneNone

WHILE THE ENGINE WAS PASSING BY THE EMPTIESHOPPER CARS SETTING ON STATE SIDING, THE ENGINEER STATED THAT IT APPEARED TO HIM THAT ON THE SECONDCAR FROM THE EAST END THAT THE BELL CRANE WAS UP. THEY DID NOT STOP TO SEE IF HAND BRAKES WERE SET.THEY NOTED THAT THE CARS WERE 5 TO 6 CARS CLEAR OF THE EAST END OF STATE SIDING. UPON REACHING THE WEST END OF THE CARS PLACED ON THE SIDING, THEY PLACED A LIT FUSEE, ENGINEER STATED TO THE BRAKEMAN THAT THE FUSEE WOULD BE THEIR MARKER AFTER THE MOVES WERE COMPLETED AS TO HOW FAR THEY COULD SHOVE BACK WITH THE CARS. THEY ENTERED INTO STATE SIDING ON THE WEST END, AFTER TYING ONTO THE CARS NO AIR WAS PUT INTO THE CARS, COMPLETING THE SWITCHING MOVEMENTS THE BRAKEMAN DID NOT RIDE THE POINT (EAST CAR) WHEN SHOVING TO PLACE THE CARS BACK ON THE SIDING, NOR WAS HAND BRAKES SET ON THE EAST END WHILESWITCHING OR AFTER THE MOVES WERE COMPLETED.
